meanings.definition: An estate in land held in fee simple or for life.
meanings.sent1: My grandparents left me a freehold when they passed away.
meanings.sent2: The freeholds in the village have been in the same families for generations.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally walked into the wrong house because all the freeholds look the same.
meanings.sent4: Her love for the old freehold was like a treasure chest full of memories.
meanings.sent5: The freehold stood proudly on the hill, a symbol of stability and permanence.

meanings.definition: The tenure by which such an estate is held.
meanings.sent1: The legal documents clearly outlined the terms of the freeholds.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the freeholds was crucial for the real estate transaction.
meanings.sent3: The freeholds seemed to have a mind of their own, dictating who could enter.
meanings.sent4: The freeholds were like ancient guardians, protecting the secrets of the land.
meanings.sent5: The freeholds whispered stories of the past to those who listened closely.

meanings.definition: The land or property so held.
meanings.sent1: The vast freeholds stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: The value of the freeholds increased with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The freeholds basked in the sunlight, content with their place in the world.
meanings.sent4: The freeholds were like pieces of a puzzle, fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The freeholds were a patchwork of colors, creating a beautiful mosaic.
